result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristie L Krause was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs & DNA surcharges on each count. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
No violent or abusive contact with Z.K.K. and Thomas Frank.
No abusive contact with Scott Liepitz.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription and from one pharmacy.
Sign releases of information. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Complete a Parenting classes.
Complete a Domestic Abuse Alternative Program.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department to be served within 60 days.- (jail sentence for count 2 only).

records.addlTxt:
11:54 a.m. Defendant Kristie L Krause in court with attorney Peter C. Lloyd. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. W/H sentence: 2 yr Probation on each count w/conditions. Count 1 to be DRI.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Ct 2, 3, & 4 No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

ADA makes sentencing arguments to the Court. (for count 2 jail only)
Atty Lloyd concurs but requests home monitor option or 5 days in jail and remaining 5 days out of jail. 

BY THE COURT:************PROBATION
Count 2: W/H sentence: 2 yr Probation
Conditions:
10 days jail, 2 days jail credit, with huber - to be served within 60 days.
Pay costs & DNA surcharge.
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
No  violent or abusive contact with Z.K.K. and Thomas Frank.
No abusive contact with Scott Liepitz.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription and from one pharmacy.
Sign releases of information. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Complete a Parenting classes.
Domestic Abuse Alternative Program.

Count 3: W/H sentence: 2 yr Probation, concurrent. Same conditions as count 2 (but no jail). Pay costs & DNA surcharge.
Count 34 W/H sentence: 2 yr Probation, concurrent. Same conditions as count 2 (but no jail). Pay costs & DNA surcharge.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 23, 2015 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Kristie L Krause in court with attorney Peter C. Lloyd. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
3:08 p.m. case is called.
Address is verified.  
ADA filed an Information with the court and provided the same to the defendant.
Appearances stated on the record.

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

ARRAIGNMENT
Court received an Information for filing.
Court informs of charges and penalties.   
Defendant and attorney have received a copy of Information.  Waives reading of the same. 
NG to all 4 counts and court accepts the plea.

Bond Continued
3:12 p.m. case is concluded.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kristie L Krause in court with attorney Peter C. Lloyd. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Initial appearance on February 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
